name: Srilatha Nenavath
title: Senior QA Automation Engineer
professional_summary: I am having 9 years of experience in QA automation and ETL testing across Healthcare, Finance, E-commerce, Government, and Telecommunications domains using tools like Selenium, Postman, and Informatica to ensure reliable applications and secure data flows.

Utilized SQL queries to validate and reconcile large datasets in healthcare and financial projects, ensuring compliance with HIPAA and PCI regulations and resolving inconsistencies efficiently within ETL pipelines.

Applied Playwright for UI and API automation to test complex web applications, catching functional and integration issues early, which reduced production defects and improved end-user experience significantly.
Configured CI/CD pipelines with Jenkins to automate test execution, ensuring continuous testing in Agile sprints and reducing manual intervention while keeping development and QA teams aligned.

Analyzed data models in SQL Server and Oracle databases to optimize queries and improve ETL process reliability, which enhanced report accuracy and facilitated smoother business operations for stakeholders.
Supported cross-functional teams by troubleshooting integration issues between applications and ETL workflows, which helped resolve blockers quickly and maintained project timelines.
Created automated test scripts for functional and regression testing using Selenium WebDriver and TestNG, improving test coverage and reducing repeated manual testing effort across multiple releases.
Improved defect tracking by integrating Jira with automated test results, enabling faster identification of root causes and effective communication with developers and business analysts.
Enhanced reporting accuracy by using ClearSearch to verify large healthcare datasets and generate reconciliation reports, which ensured compliance and minimized audit findings.
Facilitated data validation in Prudential projects by executing SQL-based checks and comparing results across staging and production environments, which prevented financial discrepancies.
Collaborated with developers and BAs to clarify requirements, identify test scenarios, and plan test execution, which strengthened QA contribution to Agile sprint deliverables.
Tested REST and SOAP APIs using Postman and SoapUI for functional and performance aspects, ensuring proper integration between microservices and reliable data exchange across applications.
Modernized legacy ETL processes by applying Informatica transformations, which optimized data flow, reduced processing time, and improved consistency for critical healthcare and finance reports.
Streamlined automated testing workflows by configuring Git repositories and branching strategies, which improved code versioning and collaboration among QA engineers and developers.
Enhanced overall test efficiency by integrating test automation with monitoring tools and logs, which helped quickly identify bottlenecks and maintain system stability for enterprise applications.
Produced detailed QA documentation for ongoing projects, including test plans, scenarios, and defect reports, which helped maintain transparency and supported knowledge sharing among teams.
Optimized load and performance testing using JMeter and LoadRunner to simulate realistic user traffic, which identified bottlenecks and improved system response times before production release.
Reviewed and updated test frameworks to include latest automation best practices, ensuring maintainability, reusability, and alignment with enterprise QA standards.

Reviewed test logs and monitoring alerts to troubleshoot failures, enabling faster issue resolution and improved system stability for production-critical healthcare applications.
Enhanced ClearSearch verification scripts to perform complex data reconciliation, ensuring data integrity across multiple sources and reducing audit-related issues.
Supported UAT sessions by preparing test cases and coordinating with business stakeholders, facilitating smooth sign-off and maintaining compliance with healthcare regulations.

Produced detailed QA documentation, including test plans, execution reports, and defect logs, which helped maintain team knowledge and project transparency.
Optimized load testing scenarios using JMeter to simulate user traffic for healthcare applications, detecting bottlenecks and improving system performance before production release.
